skill.name: product-manager-toolkit
skill.description: Comprehensive toolkit for product managers including RICE prioritization, customer interview analysis, PRD templates, discovery frameworks, and go-to-market strategies. Use for feature prioritization, user research synthesis, requirement documentation, and product strategy development.
skill.summary: Comprehensive toolkit for product managers including RICE prioritization, customer interview analysi...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: All 80 static findings are false positives. Documentation shows legitimate Python CLI commands (not backtick execution), product management terminology was misidentified as cryptographic algorithms, and standard CSV file operations were flagged as path traversal. Scripts only read user files and perform local calculations without network access or credential handling.

content.user_title: Prioritize features and analyze customer interviews
content.value_statement: Product managers need objective ways to rank feature requests and synthesize customer insights. This toolkit provides RICE scoring algorithms and NLP-based interview analysis to make data-driven prioritization decisions and document requirements clearly.
actual_capabilities: Calculate RICE scores for feature prioritization with portfolio analysis
Generate quarterly roadmaps based on team capacity planning
Extract pain points, feature requests, and sentiment from interview transcripts
Provide multiple PRD templates for different project types
Analyze job-to-be-done patterns and key themes in customer feedback
Output results in text, JSON, or CSV formats for integration
limitations: Does not connect to external tools or databases automatically
NLP analysis is pattern-based and may miss nuanced insights
Templates require manual filling and stakeholder review
RICE scores depend on user-provided data quality

use_cases.title: Feature Prioritization
use_cases.description: Calculate RICE scores to rank features objectively and plan quarterly roadmaps based on team capacity constraints.

use_cases.title: Interview Synthesis
use_cases.description: Analyze customer interview transcripts to extract pain points, feature requests, and recurring themes automatically.

use_cases.title: PRD Documentation
use_cases.description: Use structured templates to create comprehensive product requirement documents for stakeholder alignment.

prompt_templates.title: Prioritize features
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the RICE prioritizer to calculate scores for features in my_features.csv. Show top 5 features and generate a quarterly roadmap with capacity for 12 person-months.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze interviews
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze customer_interview.txt using the interview analyzer. Extract pain points with severity, feature requests, sentiment score, and key quotes.

prompt_templates.title: Create PRD
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a one-page PRD using the standard template for a new dark mode feature. Include problem statement, solution overview, success metrics, and timeline.

prompt_templates.title: Compare frameworks
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the feature portfolio for balance. Identify quick wins versus big bets. Suggest a mix of features that maximizes value while managing effort distribution.

output_examples.input: Prioritize my feature backlog using RICE scoring
output: Quick Win: Dark Mode - High impact, low effort (RICE: 800.00)
Big Bet: Team Collaboration - Massive impact, high effort (RICE: 307.69)
Suggested Q1 Roadmap: 5 features using 8 of 10 person-months
Portfolio Balance: 2 quick wins, 1 big bet, 2 incremental features
Top Pain Points: Slow performance (high), confusing interface (medium), manual workflows (high)
Key Themes: onboarding, performance, mobile, workflow
Feature Requests: Dark mode, search improvements, mobile app
Key Quote: I wish the dashboard would load faster because I check it multiple times a day

best_practices: Use actual user reach data rather than estimates for accurate RICE scoring
Conduct multiple customer interviews before synthesizing patterns across them
Update RICE scores quarterly as confidence and reach data changes over time
Involve engineering early when estimating effort for features to improve accuracy
anti_patterns: Using RICE scores without consulting engineering on effort estimates first
Ignoring low-scoring features that may be strategic business requirements
Relying solely on interview analysis without validating with behavioral data
Creating PRDs without clear success metrics or out-of-scope definitions

faq.question: Which tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It runs Python scripts locally without external dependencies.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: The RICE prioritizer accepts CSV files for features. The interview analyzer accepts plain text files for transcripts.

faq.question: Can I integrate with Jira or other tools?
faq.answer: The tool outputs JSON and CSV formats that can be imported into project management tools manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers or third parties.

faq.question: Why are my RICE scores different?
faq.answer: RICE scores depend on your input values for reach, impact, confidence, and effort. Verify your data and ensure consistent definitions.

faq.question: How does this compare to other prioritization tools?
faq.answer: This toolkit uses the established RICE framework. It provides the same methodology as paid tools but runs locally for free.
